Title: Retail General Manager
RoleDescription:
Pilot Flying J is seeking an experienced Retail General Manager to oversee our high-volume retail facilities. You will be responsible for the generation and execution of travel center and restaurant business plans to achieve established standards, sales and profit objectives as well as customer satisfaction.

The Retail General Manager will also be:Ensuring that customer expectations are metConducting meetings with subordinate employeesMaintaining effective vendor relationshipsAs a Retail General Manager for Pilot Flying J, you will build, coach, manage and develop teams from a staffing, interviewing, hiring and training standpoint.Additional responsibilities for the Retail General Manager include:Driving salesManaging team membersTracking inventoryProviding customer servicePerforming P&L analysisPay Rates Starting between: $54,300.00 - $80,750.00 / yearAs a Retail General Manager, you must exemplify integrity and accountability at the managerial level as well as demonstrate excellent team leadership skills. Furthermore, you must be able to work a flexible schedule of nights, days, weekends and holidays. Additional requirements of the Retail General Manager include:Minimum 2-3 years of management experience in the retail, restaurant, grocery or other service industry with responsibility for financial resultsPrevious management proficiency in high volume retail with P&L accountabilityAbility to create and maintain a customer focused cultureFuel DiscountNation-wide Medical Plan/Dental/Vision401(k)Flexible Spending AccountsAdoption AssistanceTuition ReimbursementFlexible ScheduleWeekly Pay

Title: Specialist I, Licensing
RoleDescription:
The purpose of this job is to prepare and file store license applications and renewals.
Essential Functions    Prepare and file store license applications and renewals including gross receipts analysis to determine renewal feesPerform duties associated with payment, accounting, and documentation of tax or license liabilities Work with third party property tax provider to manage payments and journal entries Assist in reconciling licensing, business tax, gross receipts, and property tax budgetsHelp prepare economic impact study data requestsModel behaviors that support the companys common purpose; ensure guests and team members are supported at the highest levelEnsure all activities are in compliance with rules, regulations, policies, and proceduresComplete other duties as assigned Associate degree requiredBachelors degree in accounting or related business field preferredMinimum one year multi-state general retail licensing experience preferredBasic Microsoft Office skills Familiarity with Lawson or Infor preferredFamiliarity with multi-jurisdiction and Canadian tax and licensing lawsExcellent analytical, critical thinking, and organizational skillsStrong attention to detailExcellent written and oral communication skillsAbility to make decisions and work with minimal supervisionAbility to set priorities, multitask, meet deadlines, and resolve problems with a high sense of urgencyAbility to work extended hours as needed to meet deadlines   Travel required less than 5%General office work requiring sitting or standing for long periods of timeAbility to lift up to 20 pounds

Title: Engineer II, Industrial Automation
RoleDescription: SummaryThe purpose of this position is to ensure safe, efficient reliable operation of process control systems and related instrumentation, including process historian databases, automated reports, distributed control systems, supervisory control and data acquisition systems (SCADAs), programmable logic controllers, human machine interface user interface products, and related devices and instrumentation.Essential FunctionsManage, provide upkeep, and develop automated reports and databases using programming languages such as VBA and SQL, as well as manage and oversee Historian databases at various facilities.Troubleshoot/resolve hardware and process issues.Optimize process controls/systems to maximize facility safety, efficiency and productivity.Ensure conformance of process control hardware and processes with the requirements of appropriate facility Process Hazard Analyses and safe operations documentation.Properly apply Process Safety Management standards, including Management of Change procedures to all process control hardware and process improvements.Review and approve scope of all work performed by third-party original equipment manufacturers, industrial control systems consultants, contractors and integrators to ensure safe, efficient performance of all work.Update facility standard operating procedures pursuant to updates/improvements in process control systems.Monitor performance of industrial process control systems, including  but not limited to fuel processing equipment, vapor processing equipment, loading/unloading/blending equipment, SCADA systems, etc. and make adjustments to operating parameters as necessary to maintain safe, efficient Plant operations, maximize production and produce products that conform to applicable specifications/regulations. Utilize the industrial control system to capture, log and report facility performance data such as key performance indicators (KPIs) as directed by management.Plan process systems upgrades and preventative maintenance to ensure proper system performance, maintain third-party warranties/support and system cybersecurity.Ensure strict adherence to safe work practices, programs and permits for all employees, visitors, and contractors, including, but not limited practices, programs and permits pertaining to safe work, hot work, confined space entry/work, lockout/tagout, hydrogen sulfide monitoring/training, maintenance and use of Self-Contained Breathing Apparatus (SCBA), fire monitoring, etc.Respond in a timely manner to all facility issues that adversely impact safe, efficient Plant operations, regulatory compliance or otherwise require the attention of an Industrial Controls Engineer.Ensure timely third-party inspection and repair of process control equipment.Model behaviors that support the company's common purpose; ensure guests and team members are supported at the highest levelEnsure all activities comply with rules, regulations, policies, and proceduresComplete other duties as assigned by management.BS in Engineering, Materials Science or Physics or Equivalent Technical Background requiredBS in Chemical, Electrical or Mechanical Engineering preferred2-4 years of industrial controls experience requiredSpecialized KnowledgeAdvanced knowledge in industrial process control systems and logicProcess Safety Management experience requiredCompetenciesExcellent written, verbal, and listening communication skillsDemonstrated ability to apply mathematics, chemistry and process logic in an industrial process/production environment.Attention to detail and organizational skillsAbility to take on and off a SCBATravelLess than 15% travel requiredPhysical Requirements & Working ConditionsAble to sit and/or stand for long periods of timeLift up to 75 poundsUse heavy tools (e.g. pipe wrench)Able to pass pulmonary fitness test, SCBA mask fit test and physicalAble to see and use both hands for operating machinery and packing productsAble to stoop, bend, and reachAvailable to work long hours as neededNation-wide Medical Plan/Dental/Vision401(k) Flexible Spending AccountsAdoption AssistanceTuition ReimbursementWeekly Pay#LI-AP1

The ideal candidate for this position would possess excellent customer service skills to respond to the needs of customers. In addition, this candidate would be self-motivated and ready to assist the managers with any tasks that need to be executed to keep our facilities well-maintained and running smoothly. This person would be knowledgeable of store operations and PFJ's commitment to quality and customer service.Pay Rates Starting between: $14.16 - $20.58 / hourPrevious experience or working knowledge of restaurant operationsIncredible customer service skills & the ability to help maintain a customer focused cultureMust be proficient with a calculator, computer, and other equipmentAbility to work as part of a team and interact with different levels from hourly team members, customers, vendors, and corporate representativesMust be able to work a flexible schedule of nights, days, weekends, and holidaysBackground check is requiredFuel DiscountNation-wide Medical Plan/Dental/Vision401(k)Flexible Spending AccountsAdoption AssistanceTuition ReimbursementFlexible ScheduleWeekly Pay

Title: Wendy's General Manager
RoleDescription:
Pilot Flying J is seeking highly-skilled, experienced Restaurant General Managers to run our high-volume, quick service restaurants. Applicants for this position must be willing to relocate.

Our General Managers are accountable for the financial and operational performance of the restaurant and are responsible for the following tasks:Ensuring excellent hospitality and guest serviceCreating a positive work environment for team membersImplementing Human Resource decisionsPerforming P&L analysisControlling inventoryPay Rates Starting between: $43,888.00 - $59,050.00 / yearAs a Restaurant General Manager, you must have excellent team leadership and customer service skills. You must also exemplify integrity and accountability at the managerial level.Additional requirements of the Restaurant General Manager include:Minimum 2-3 years of management experience in the retail, restaurant, grocery or other service industry with responsibility for financial resultsPrevious management proficiency in high volume retail with P&L accountabilityAbility to work a flexible schedule of nights, days, weekends and holidaysFuel DiscountNation-wide Medical Plan/Dental/Vision401(k)Flexible Spending AccountsAdoption AssistanceTuition ReimbursementFlexible ScheduleWeekly Pay
